qas.question: Around when did the Annexation of Alsace occur?
With education reforms in the 19th century what did this lead to in Alsace?

answers.text: middle classes began to speak and write French

qas.question: What is now the German dialects of speech now referred as to?
When did French become the most common language?
When did writing French in the middle class fall out of fashion?
Standard Germany became policy during what revolution?
What helped German literacy in the 19th century?

context: From the annexation of Alsace by France in <b4_0>the <a0_0>17th century<b4_0/><a0_0/> and the language policy of <b6_0>the French Revolution<b6_0/> up to <b3_0>1870<b3_0/>, knowledge of French in Alsace increased considerably. With the <b7_0>education reforms<b7_0/> of <b5_0>the 19th century<b5_0/>, the <a1_0>middle classes began to speak and write French<a1_0/> well. The French language never really managed, however, to win over the masses, the vast majority of whom continued to speak their German dialects and write in German (which we would now call "<a2_0>standard German<a2_0/>").[citation needed]
